revised_title: Catalogue of Nebulae and Clusters of Stars in the Southern Hemisphere
tldr: This article presents a catalogue of 629 nebulae and clusters of stars in the Southern Hemisphere, observed by James Dunlop using a 9-feet reflecting telescope. The observations reveal that most nebulae have a low state of condensation, with few in a moderate state. Some nebulae contain bright points that may be stars, while many are faint and ill-defined. The author notes that the true nature of nebulae remains uncertain, as instruments of the time were unable to provide definitive answers.
